Soni floated shell companies promising high returns. He is now in judicial custody.

title: IndiGo crisis: Centre orders cap on domestic fares; check pricing details
content: Aviation Ministry has imposed emergency fare caps on domestic flights to combat soaring ticket prices following widespread cancellations by a major airline.  New maximum fares range from Rs 7,500 to Rs 18,000 based on distance, excluding taxes.  These temporary restrictions aim to protect passengers from exploitation and ensure travel affordability until the situation stabilizes.

title: ‚ÄòOn life support‚Äô: Omar flags INDIA bloc crisis after Bihar debacle; BJP reacts
content: Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah stated the INDIA alliance is "on life support," citing internal infighting and weak organization as reasons for its inability to challenge the BJP. He blamed the bloc for Nitish Kumar's return to the NDA and highlighted organizational failures, suggesting Congress must lead any serious opposition challenge.

title: US govt is quite angry with Europe and 'reason' is Elon Musk's X
content: The EU has fined Elon Musk's X platform ‚Ç¨120 million for violating digital transparency rules, particularly its 'blue checkmark' system. This move has ignited a diplomatic spat with the US, with officials accusing Brussels of attacking American free speech and tech companies. EU officials, however, maintain the penalty targets transparency, not censorship.

title: 'Chal waps ja!': Kuldeep gets schooled by Rohit and Kohli during DRS drama - watch
content: During India's series-clinching ODI against South Africa, Rohit Sharma, despite not captaining, humorously intervened to prevent Kuldeep Yadav from taking unnecessary DRS reviews.  Sharma, supported by Virat Kohli, repeatedly signaled against reviews, showcasing a blend of humor and strategic insight that ultimately proved correct, as Kuldeep later admitted his reliance on such guidance.

title: South Africa shooting: Gunmen open fire at illegal Pretoria bar; 11 killed
content: Gunmen killed at least 11 people, including a three-year-old, at an illegal bar in Pretoria's Saulsville township early Saturday. Fourteen others were wounded in the indiscriminate shooting. Police are searching for three suspects, highlighting a challenge with unlicensed liquor premises where many mass shootings occur.

title: Sanju Samson sends a strong message to Gautam Gambhir ahead of South Africa T20Is
content: Sanju Samson's unbeaten 73 anchored Kerala's low score against Andhra Pradesh in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. This captain's knock, his second fifty this season, highlights his consistent domestic form amidst ongoing questions about his role in India's T20 setup. With competition for wicketkeeping spots, Samson's future in the playing XI remains uncertain.

title: IBM CEO's message to Google, Amazon, Microsoft & other tech companies
content: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna cautions that massive AI infrastructure investments by tech giants may not yield expected returns, citing exorbitant data center costs and rapid chip obsolescence. He believes the race for AGI is a motivator, but current technology has a low chance of achieving it. Krishna also attributes tech layoffs to pandemic-era over-hiring rather than AI.

title: ‚ÄòMetaverse‚Äô budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
content: Meta is reportedly planning to significantly cut its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its virtual reality ambitions. This move follows substantial losses and a lack of consumer interest in its VR products. The company is now prioritizing its artificial intelligence initiatives.

title: 'Was distressed over financial issues': Engineer jumps to death in front of Bengaluru metro
content: Namma Metro's Purple Line services were disrupted for over an hour after a design engineer died by suicide on the tracks at Kengeri station. The incident, which occurred during peak morning hours, caused significant inconvenience to thousands of passengers. Police are investigating the incident, with preliminary reports suggesting depression as a possible motive.

title: 'Biryani for 40k‚Äô: Suspended TMC MLA lays ‚ÄòBabri Masjid‚Äô foundation; heavy security posted
content: Suspended TMC MLA Humayun Kabir laid the foundation stone for a "Babri Masjid-style" mosque in Murshidabad, West Bengal, despite his party suspension and heightened security. The event, involving extensive arrangements and an expected turnout of nearly 3 lakh people, is seen as a significant show of strength for the MLA in the region.

title: Candace Owens slammed for ‚Äòrunning scared‚Äô from Charlie Kirk livestream
content: Candace Owens is facing criticism for contradicting herself. She publicly offered to debate Turning Point USA (TPUSA) leadership anytime, anywhere. However, when TPUSA scheduled a livestream to address her claims, Owens pushed back on the logistics. Critics accuse her of creating drama rather than accepting the challenge she initiated. The situation has become a test of consistency for the commentator.

title: Aryna Sabalenka & Georgios Frangulis net worth: Earnings, endorsements, business
content: Tennis star Aryna Sabalenka and her boyfriend, Oakberry founder Georgios Frangulis, are a financially successful couple. Sabalenka boasts a net worth in the high teens of millions from her WTA career and endorsements, while Frangulis's stake in his rapidly expanding a√ßa√≠ company places him in the multi-million-dollar range. Their combined wealth is estimated to be in the tens of millions.

title: NBA trade rumors: Warriors may re-sign $190M guard to help Stephen Curry
content: Golden State Warriors are reportedly considering a reunion with former star Klay Thompson, now with the Dallas Mavericks. Amidst organizational shifts in Dallas and the Warriors' ongoing search for consistent three-point shooting, a trade for Thompson is being discussed. His return could bolster Golden State's offense and recapture championship magic.

title: Why food fried in reused oil could expose you to higher cancer risk
content: Repeatedly heating cooking oil triggers chemical changes, leading to the formation of harmful compounds that compromise its safety and nutritional value. This degradation can increase the risk of certain cancers and negatively impact cardiovascular and metabolic health over time. Practicing safe frying techniques and being aware of oil's warning signs are crucial for mitigating these risks.

title: De Kock hits new landmarks: Overtakes Kohli, equals Sachin in top ODI records
content: This was de Kock‚Äôs seventh ODI hundred in just 23 innings against India. No player has scored more hundreds against India. He is now level with Sanath Jayasuriya, who also has seven but reached the mark in 85 innings. De Kock also moved level with AB de Villiers for the most ODI hundreds by a visiting batter in India.

title: 3 supplement that can reverse ageing as per a neuroscientist
content: With Alzheimer's risk rising, neuroscientists are exploring supplements to support brain health. Dr. Robert W. Love highlights nitric oxide boosters for improved blood flow, creatine for cellular energy and cognitive function, and NMN to enhance NAD+ levels for cellular repair and energy metabolism, offering promising avenues for brain protection.

title: Airfares skyrocket amid IndiGo crisis: Govt reimposes fare caps; airlines told to strictly comply
content: The government has reimposed airfare caps on airlines for the first time since Covid, citing unusually high ticket prices due to the IndiGo crisis. These caps aim to protect passengers from opportunistic pricing until IndiGo operations normalize, expected by December 15. The move comes as many passengers faced exorbitant fares after IndiGo cancellations.

title: India-US trade: Next round of talks to start from Dec 10
content: India and the US are set to hold crucial trade talks in New Delhi from December 10-12 to finalize the initial phase of a pact. This follows recent US tariffs on Indian goods. Both nations aim to resolve tariff issues and boost bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030, addressing concerns over falling Indian exports to the US.

title: Sonu Sood calls it ‚Äòunfair‚Äô to hold IndiGo ground staff responsible
content: Actor Sonu Sood has appealed to passengers to remain calm and refrain from targeting IndiGo ground staff amidst widespread flight delays and cancellations.  He acknowledged the frustration but urged empathy for employees who are equally helpless.  The DGCA has formed a committee to investigate the operational disruptions that left thousands stranded.

title: Turkey: 7 killed, 11 injured after intercity bus crashes into lorry; driver detained
content: An intercity bus collided with a lorry on a southern Turkish motorway early Saturday, resulting in at least seven fatalities and 11 injuries. The bus struck the rear of the stationary lorry, which had stopped due to a burst tyre. All victims were bus passengers and the lorry driver is in custody.

title: Shubman Gill cleared to play T20I series vs South Africa
content: Shubman Gill had been included in the T20I squad subject to fitness and was required to undergo a full set of rehabilitation and skill-based Return To Play (RTP) protocols.  Gill's injury occurred due to a whiplash incident on the second day of the Kolkata Test, resulting in Gill being hospitalised for a couple of days and administered an injection.

title: ‚ÄòAny dish for Rs 30‚Äô: Bengaluru pub‚Äôs offer leads to chaos, traffic jam in city
content: A 'dish for Rs 30' anniversary offer at a Bengaluru pub backfired, drawing a thousand-strong crowd far exceeding its 300-person capacity. Chaos ensued, leading to traffic jams and the pub's early closure. Police intervened to disperse the frustrated, hungry patrons who had waited for hours, some arriving after the offer had ended.

title: Hong Kong fire: Unsafe contractor given 'clean record' before blaze that killed 159 - report
content: Homeowners in Hong Kong were misled about a contractor's safety record before a devastating fire. Documents reveal the firm blamed for the blaze, Prestige Construction, had a history of safety violations, despite assurances from an architectural consultant. Investigations are underway into manslaughter and corruption following the tragedy that claimed at least 159 lives.

title: 'This is harassment, it is our money': DK Shivakumar reacts to ED notice in National Herald case
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar received a notice from Delhi Police's EOW seeking financial records related to donations to Young Indian. Shivakumar termed the summons "shocking," stating he'd already provided information to the ED and views it as harassment against Congress leaders. Investigators are probing fund sources and third-party instructions.

title: Delhi: How digital ghost twice haunted man accused of killing his mother
content: A matricide suspect, Animesh Jha, who fled to Nepal five years ago on pandemic-era bail, has been apprehended at the Indo-Nepal border. Jha, a software engineer, allegedly murdered his mother in 2017 during a drug-fueled argument over finances. He was tracked down through electronic surveillance and lured back to India.

title: Two Telangana villages, two battles: Residents stuck in 40-year poll freeze
content: Gudem village has boycotted local elections since 1983 over ST reservations, claiming no such community resides there. This has led to severe underdevelopment, water scarcity, and depreciating land values. Despite pleas and even boycotting Lok Sabha polls, the issue remains unresolved, impacting hundreds of villagers who are denied opportunities and fair land prices.

title: KL Rahul's unique coin-toss hack hands Gautam Gambhir his first win
content: The crowd roared and a smiling KL Rahul elected to bowl in the deciding third match of the series, which is level at 1-1. India's players were quick to congratulate Rahul, who is leading the ODI team in place of the injured Shubman Gill.

title: Assam tea, Kashmiri saffron & more: What PM Modi gifted Putin ‚Äî in pictures
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi presented Russian President Vladimir Putin with specially curated gifts showcasing Indian culture during his two-day visit for the 23rd India-Russia Annual Summit. The gifts included a Russian edition of the Srimad Bhagavad Gita, GI-tagged Assam tea, Kashmiri saffron, and a silver tea set, highlighting India's heritage and craftsmanship.

title: Tears and frustration at airports across India as IndiGo cancels 1,000+ flights
content: IndiGo cancelled over 1,000 flights, causing widespread travel chaos across India. The government has put new pilot duty time rules on hold and set up a committee to review the disruptions. Passengers faced significant delays, missed competitions, and lost luggage, with normal operations expected to resume between December 10-15.

title: 'Dhurandhar' ending explained: What is Ranveer‚Äôs actual name? Here‚Äôs what we know
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has stormed the box office, opening to ‚Çπ27 crore and exceeding expectations. The film's post-credit scene reveals a revenge mission against ISI's Major Iqbal, confirming a Part 2 release on March 19, 2026, and hinting at further secrets.

title: 'Yessss!!!': KL Rahul breaks 20-game curse with epic toss celebration ‚Äì watch
content: India won the toss and elected to field against South Africa in the third and final ODI of the series at the ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium in Visakhapatnam on Saturday. The last time India won the toss in an ODI was during the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 semi-final against New Zealand at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium.

title: ‚ÄòDhurandhar‚Äô box office collection : Ranveer Singh‚Äôs film crosses Rs 30cr mark
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has stormed the box office, becoming the second biggest opener of 2025. The film crossed Rs 30 crore by its second day, surpassing the opening weekend collection of the previously successful 'Saiyaara'. Inspired by true events like the Kandahar Hijack and 26/11 attacks, the action drama features a strong ensemble cast.

title: Reverse kidney damage: A breakthrough treatment that may transform kidney treatment
content: A groundbreaking discovery offers hope for reversing kidney damage, challenging the notion that it's irreversible. Researchers found that blocking ceramides, fats linked to kidney cell injury, protected and restored normal function in animal trials. This breakthrough could shift kidney disease treatment from slowing decline to actively restoring health, potentially reducing the need for dialysis and transplantation.

title: Conor McGregor calls out Islam Makhachev as he targets UFC 170-lb title next
content: Conor McGregor eyes a UFC comeback in June 2025 at a White House event. He aims for Islam Makhachev's welterweight belt, seeking a historic triple crown. McGregor is training intensely. He also remains open to a fight with Michael Chandler. Contract talks are expected by February 2025. The UFC is finalizing plans for this significant return.

title: IndiGo cancellations: Foreigner loses cool, climbs atop counter at Mumbai airport ‚Äî watch
content: Widespread IndiGo flight cancellations on Saturday left thousands of passengers stranded across India, leading to scenes of frustration and protests at airports. Despite the aviation regulator pausing recent flight duty time limitations, disruptions continued, impacting crucial travel plans for many, including a team selected for the Smart India Hackathon.

title: Carpool moment with PM Modi, banquet dinner & trade decisions ‚Äî highlights from Putin‚Äôs visit
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin concluded his two-day state visit to India, marked by a warm reception from PM Modi and discussions on strengthening bilateral ties. Key outcomes included a new economic cooperation program aiming for $100 billion trade by 2030 and a focus on peace efforts in Ukraine.

title: 'Exceptional': SBI hails RBI's repo rate cut, Central bank played its part
content: The Reserve Bank of India cut the repo rate to 5.25% amid strong economic growth and exceptionally low inflation, a move hailed as exceptional by SBI Research. This decision, supported by a unanimous Monetary Policy Committee vote, aims to sustain India's economic momentum. The central bank anticipates continued growth and low inflation, though external factors pose potential risks.

title: Bengaluru fans unhappy with RCB chatter: Venkatesh Prasad
content: Venkatesh Prasad is contesting the KSCA polls on December 7 with his panel 'Team Game Changers', aiming to end a "25-year reign". The former India cricketer wants to address transparency and mismanagement in the cricket body, and has vowed to make all efforts for getting international cricket back to the Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

title: 'It was never through effort': Gukesh reacts to Anish Giri's 'different person' remark
content: Dutch No. 1 Anish Giri described D Gukesh‚Äôs ability to switch into distinct ‚Äúmodes‚Äù depending on the situation, calling him a completely different person on and off the board. Gukesh later said on X that this trait is natural. With Giri already qualified for the 2026 Candidates, the two may meet sooner in the upcoming Global Chess League (GCL).

title: Day 5 of IndiGo turmoil: Over 400 flights cancelled across four major airports - top developments
content: IndiGo on Saturday cancelled over 400 flights across four major airports on Saturday due to ongoing pilot rostering issues, despite temporary relief from new duty rules. The airline has apologized, is processing refunds, and arranging support for stranded passengers. The Civil Aviation Minister has launched a formal probe into the disruptions.

title: MLS Cup preview: Messi's Miami has too much momentum for Caps to stop
content: 'Futbol Americas' team react to inter Miami's 5-1 win over new york city . MLS Cup: Inter Miami vs. the Vancouver whitecaps . the event marks the first time Lionel Messi & Co. have had an opportunity to secure the piece of silverware that the south Floridians have craved .

title: Want a Kalen DeBoer 'Black Hoodie of Death'? Good luck
content: "Excuse me," a woman says as she sifted through the endless round racks of Alabama Crimson Tide apparel . "i was hoping to buy him one of those Coach DeBoer Black Hoodies of Death," she says . all those stores do have plenty of something similar .

title: Does Kirby Smart have an Alabama problem?
content: this season's matchup will fall under the "both" category, marking the fourth time in ten years that the Crimson Tide and Bulldogs have met in Atlanta to determine the conference's champion . it has also resurfaced a fascinating trend: Georgia coach Kirby Smart's struggles to overcome Alabama .

content: USC has put itself in position to snap the five-cycle streak of SEC teams finishing with the No. 1-ranked class . some programs, including the no. 1 overall player, Lamar Brown, remain unsigned . there are still questions to be answered and opportunities to make a move in the 2026 class rankings .

title: Penn State hires Cyclones' Campbell as new coach
content: the deal will go before the compensation committee of the school's board of trustees for final approval . "Coach Campbell is, without a doubt, the right leader at the right time for Penn State football," athletic director Patrick Kraft says . the winningest coach in Iowa State history met with officials Thursday night before negotiating a deal .

title: How the U.S. matches up against group stage foes
content: usmNT have been handed a favourable draw with their opponents in world cup group d . we know who, where and when the tournament's hosts will play . there's a chance that the U.S. will end up in a group with three teams it has already played in 2025 .
